objenome.solver.evolve.init

Class Grow

  • java.lang.Object
    • objenome.solver.evolve.init.Grow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Listener<ConfigEvent>, TypedInitialization, OrganismBuilder<TypedOrganism>

    public class Grow
extends java.lang.Object
implements TypedInitialization, Listener<ConfigEvent>
    Initialisation method which produces STGPIndividuals with program trees within a specified maximum depth. Program trees are constructed randomly from the nodes in the syntax, with each node's data-type constraints enforced.

    See the #setup() method documentation for a list of configuration parameters used to control this operator.

    Since:
    2.0
    See Also:
    Full, RampedHalfAndHalf

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grow

        public Grow()
        Constructs a GrowInitialisation with control parameters automatically loaded from the config

      • Grow

        public Grow(boolean autoConfig)
        Constructs a GrowInitialisation with control parameters initially loaded from the config. If the autoConfig argument is set to true then the configuration will be automatically updated when the config is modified.
        Parameters:
        autoConfig - whether this operator should automatically update its configuration settings from the config

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public void setup(GPContainer config)
        Sets up this operator with the appropriate configuration settings. This method is called whenever a ConfigEvent occurs for a change in any of the following configuration parameters:
        • RandomSequence.RANDOM_SEQUENCE
        • Population.SIZE
        • TypedOrganism.SYNTAX
        • TypedOrganism.RETURN_TYPE
        • TypedOrganism.MAXIMUM_DEPTH
        • TypedInitialization.MAXIMUM_INITIAL_DEPTH
        • OrganismBuilder.ALLOW_DUPLICATES (default: true)

      • onEvent

        public void onEvent(ConfigEvent event)
        Receives configuration events and triggers this operator to configure its parameters if the ConfigEvent is for one of its required parameters.
        Specified by:
        onEvent in interface Listener<ConfigEvent>
        Parameters:
        event - the fired event object.

      • createPopulation

        public Population createPopulation(Population survivors,
                                   GPContainer config)
        Creates a population of new STGPIndividuals from the Nodes provided by the TypedOrganism.SYNTAX config parameter. Each individual is created by a call to the createIndividual method. The size of the population will be equal to the Population.SIZE config parameter. If the OrganismBuilder.ALLOW_DUPLICATES config parameter is set to false then the individuals in the population will be unique according to their equals methods. By default, duplicates are allowed.
        Specified by:
        createPopulation in interface OrganismBuilder<TypedOrganism>
        Returns:
        a population of STGPIndividual objects

      • newOrganism

        public TypedOrganism newOrganism()
        Constructs a new STGPIndividual instance with a grown program tree composed of nodes provided by the TypedOrganism.SYNTAX config parameter. Each node in the tree is randomly chosen from those nodes with a valid data-type. If the maximum depth has not been reached then the node is selected from all valid terminals or non-terminals and at one less than the maximum depth only the terminals are chosen from.
        Specified by:
        newOrganism in interface OrganismBuilder<TypedOrganism>
        Returns:
        a new individual with a full program tree

      • populate

        public void populate(Population<TypedOrganism> population,
                     int populationSize)
        Specified by:
        populate in interface OrganismBuilder<TypedOrganism>

      • createTree

        public Node createTree()
        Creates a program tree within the maximum depth as specified by the getMaximumDepth method. The nodes in the tree are randomly chosen from those nodes in the syntax with a data-type that matches the requirements of their parent (or the problem for the root node).
        Returns:
        the root node of the generated program tree

      • varieties

        public java.math.BigInteger varieties(int remainingDepth,
                                      java.lang.Class<?> returnType)
        Returns a count of the number of different node trees that are possible with the available nodes and a maximum depth. This is effectively a count of the size of the search-space.
        Parameters:
        remainingDepth - the available depth in which the varieties are constrained
        returnType - the required return type of the varieties
        Returns:
        a BigInteger which is a count of the number of varieties

      • sufficientVarieties

        public boolean sufficientVarieties(int remainingDepth,
                                   java.lang.Class<?> returnType,
                                   java.math.BigInteger target)
        Tests whether the number of different node trees that are possible according to the varieties method is greater than or equal to a specified target. This method is more efficient than getting the total number of varieties and doing a comparison, because it may return a result without completing the count.
        Parameters:
        remainingDepth - the available depth in which the varieties are constrained
        returnType - the required return type of the varieties
        target - the number of varieties that is considered sufficient
        Returns:
        true if the number of varieties is equal to or greater than target and false otherwise.

      • isDuplicatesEnabled

        public boolean isDuplicatesEnabled()
        Returns whether or not duplicates are currently allowed in generated populations
        Returns:
        true if duplicates are currently allowed in populations generated by the createPopulation method and false otherwise

      • setDuplicatesEnabled

        public void setDuplicatesEnabled(boolean allowDuplicates)
        Sets whether duplicates should be allowed in populations that are generated. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the OrganismBuilder.ALLOW_DUPLICATES configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        allowDuplicates - whether duplicates should be allowed in populations that are generated

      • getSyntax

        public Node[] getSyntax()
        Returns the array of nodes in the available syntax. Program trees are generated using the nodes in this array.
        Returns:
        an array of the nodes in the syntax

      • setSyntax

        public void setSyntax(Node[] syntax)
        Sets the array of nodes to generate program trees from. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the TypedOrganism.SYNTAX configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        syntax - an array of nodes to generate new program trees from

      • getReturnType

        public java.lang.Class<?> getReturnType()
        Returns the required data-type of the return for program trees generated with this initialisation method
        Returns:
        the return type of the program trees generated

      • setReturnType

        public void setReturnType(java.lang.Class<?> returnType)
        Sets the required data-type of the program trees generated. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the TypedOrganism.RETURN_TYPE configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        returnType - the data-type of the generated programs

      • setPopulationSize

        public void setPopulationSize(int size)

        Parameters:
        size - the size of the populations generated

      • getMaximumDepth

        public int getMaximumDepth()
        Returns the maximum depth of the program trees generated with this initialisation method
        Returns:
        the maximum depth of the program trees constructed

      • setMaximumDepth

        public void setMaximumDepth(int maxDepth)
        Sets the maximum depth of the program trees created by the createIndividual method. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the TypedInitialization.MAXIMUM_INITIAL_DEPTH configuration setting on the next config event, or the TypedOrganism.MAXIMUM_DEPTH setting if no initial maximum depth is set.
        Parameters:
        maxDepth - the maximum depth of all program trees generated

      • getRandomSequence

        public RandomSequence getRandomSequence()
        Returns the random number sequence in use
        Returns:
        the currently set random sequence

      • setRandomSequence

        public void setRandomSequence(RandomSequence random)
        Sets the random number sequence to use. If automatic configuration is enabled thenAny value set here will be overwritten by the RandomSequence.RANDOM_SEQUENCE configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        random - the random number generator to set
